requirement_tested: A frontend dashboard interface that displays financial data from multiple companies
user_persona: A financial analyst reviewing quarterly performance across several client companies.
user_goal: Quickly assess the latest financial health of multiple companies at a glance.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Maria logs in and lands on the main dashboard. She immediately sees a grid of summary cards, each representing a company's latest financial snapshot.
narrative_steps.action: Load the dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A mint cream background fills the screen with teal-styled summary cards showing each company's name, logo placeholder, and key metrics like revenue and profit.

narrative_steps.title: Hovering Over Summary Card
narrative_steps.description: Maria hovers her mouse over one of the company cards to get more attention on it.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a company summary card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The card gains a subtle shadow effect indicating interactivity.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Detailed View
narrative_steps.description: She clicks on a specific company card to dive deeper into its financial history.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a company summary card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard transitions to the detailed financial data view for the selected company.

requirement_tested: Backend API endpoints to fetch financial data from an external PostgreSQL database
user_persona: A developer verifying backend integration with the financial database.
user_goal: Confirm that the backend correctly retrieves and structures financial data from the database.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Companies List
narrative_steps.description: The frontend makes a request to retrieve all registered companies from the database.
narrative_steps.action: Send a GET request to `/api/companies`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a JSON array of company objects with id, name, and industry fields matching the companiesTableSchema.

narrative_steps.title: Requesting Financial Data
narrative_steps.description: The developer now requests financial data for a specific company using its UUID.
narrative_steps.action: Send a GET request to `/api/financial-data/{companyId}`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receives a structured JSON response containing historical financial records aligned with financialDataTableSchema.

requirement_tested: User authentication and authorization to access the multi-company dashboard
user_persona: A new employee logging into the financial dashboard for the first time.
user_goal: Access the dashboard securely using personal login credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Dashboard Without Session
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the dashboard URL but hasn't logged in yet.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard landing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to a login form with fields for username and password.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Credentials
narrative_steps.description: He enters his assigned username and password into the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in username and password fields, then press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are sent to the server; upon successful validation, he is redirected to the main dashboard with a JWT token saved locally.

requirement_tested: Company selection interface allowing users to switch between different company views
user_persona: A portfolio manager tracking investments across various firms.
user_goal: Easily switch focus between different companies’ financial data.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Company Selector
narrative_steps.description: Sarah looks at the top of the dashboard where she finds the company selector dropdown.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Select Company' dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of available companies fetched from the backend appears below the dropdown.

narrative_steps.title: Switching Company View
narrative_steps.description: She selects a different company from the list to review its financials.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a company option in the dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard content updates dynamically to display data exclusively for the chosen company.

requirement_tested: Consolidated financial reports view aggregating data across all selected companies
user_persona: A CFO preparing for a board meeting requiring an overview of group performance.
user_goal: View and analyze consolidated financial summaries across all active companies.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Consolidated Reports
narrative_steps.description: James navigates to the consolidated reports section from the sidebar menu.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Consolidated Reports' link in navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Loads a full-screen panel displaying aggregated financial KPIs and a bar chart visualization.

narrative_steps.title: Refreshing Report with New Dates
narrative_steps.description: He adjusts the date range to match the last quarter before regenerating the report.
narrative_steps.action: Modify start/end dates and click 'Generate Report'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart and summary numbers update to reflect only the specified period’s aggregated data.

requirement_tested: Cross-company comparison charts and tables for financial metrics
user_persona: An equity researcher evaluating competitive positioning among peers.
user_goal: Compare key financial metrics across multiple companies visually and numerically.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Comparison Screen
narrative_steps.description: Emma accesses the cross-company comparison tool to evaluate revenue trends.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the comparison section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two panels load side-by-side—one showing a sortable table and the other a trend line chart for selected companies.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Table Rows
narrative_steps.description: She clicks a row in the table to highlight the corresponding data series in the chart.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a table row.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The associated company’s data points on the chart become visually emphasized.

requirement_tested: Financial data browsing by company with filtering and sorting capabilities
user_persona: An auditor checking transactional accuracy for a particular firm.
user_goal: Browse and sort historical financial entries efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Company Financial History
narrative_steps.description: David selects a company and views its financial data presented in a tabular format.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the financial data browsing view for a selected company.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A paginated table loads with columns for date, revenue, profit, and expenses.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting Entries
narrative_steps.description: He wants to see the highest profits first, so he clicks the 'Profit' column header.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Profit' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Table rows reorder descending by profit value.

requirement_tested: Real-time updates of financial data through dynamic API calls
user_persona: A trader monitoring live fluctuations in corporate earnings.
user_goal: Stay informed about real-time changes in financial figures without manual refresh.

narrative_steps.title: Activating Live Updates
narrative_steps.description: Nina notices a toggle for real-time updates and enables it to track ongoing changes.
narrative_steps.action: Toggle the 'Real-Time Updates' switch to ON.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A WebSocket connection establishes and begins receiving live financial updates from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Live Changes
narrative_steps.description: As market conditions shift, she watches the dashboard numbers adjust automatically.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for incoming live data events.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Displayed financial values update instantly in response to new data pushed from the server.

requirement_tested: Teal-themed UI components styled consistently throughout the application
user_persona: A UX designer auditing brand consistency during product launch.
user_goal: Verify that all interactive elements use the correct teal theme styling.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Button Styles
narrative_steps.description: Tom inspects various buttons across the dashboard to confirm they follow the teal palette.
narrative_steps.action: Visit multiple dashboard sections and observe button appearances.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All buttons utilize the teal color scheme defined in tealColorPalette and maintain readability.

requirement_tested: Mint cream background color applied across all dashboard pages
user_persona: A front-end developer validating CSS implementation.
user_goal: Ensure consistent application-wide use of mint cream background.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Background Across Pages
narrative_steps.description: Riley visits multiple dashboard routes to verify consistent background styling.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate between dashboard pages (home, reports, comparisons).
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each page displays a solid mint cream (#F5FFFA) background as defined in backgroundStyleClass.

requirement_tested: Interactive reporting tools enabling users to generate custom financial reports
user_persona: A department head needing a specialized report for internal planning.
user_goal: Build and export a custom financial report tailored to his team's needs.

narrative_steps.title: Using Custom Report Builder
narrative_steps.description: Michael drags desired financial metrics onto the canvas to construct his report.
narrative_steps.action: Drag metric blocks into the report builder area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Selected metrics appear in the preview pane ready for configuration.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Final Report
narrative_steps.description: After setting filters, he clicks the generate button to produce the document.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Generate' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A downloadable PDF or CSV file is produced based on the customized setup.

requirement_tested: Data visualization components such as graphs, charts, and summary cards
user_persona: A business stakeholder presenting quarterly results to executives.
user_goal: Present clear visual insights derived from complex financial datasets.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Summary Cards
narrative_steps.description: Lisa scans the summary cards at the top of the dashboard for quick takeaways.
narrative_steps.action: Load the dashboard and scan the top summary cards.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Cards clearly display major KPIs like revenue and profit using the standard template structure.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Chart Details
narrative_steps.description: She hovers over segments of a pie chart to reveal precise percentage breakdowns.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over segments in a chart visualization.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltips appear showing exact numeric values and labels for hovered chart regions.

requirement_tested: Responsive layout ensuring usability on desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: A remote worker accessing the dashboard from a tablet during travel.
user_goal: Use the dashboard effectively regardless of device size.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Browser Window
narrative_steps.description: On her laptop, Priya resizes the window to simulate mobile viewing.
narrative_steps.action: Manually resize browser window to narrow width.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adapts responsively—navigation collapses into a hamburger menu and components rearrange accordingly.

narrative_steps.title: Toggling Mobile Menu
narrative_steps.description: She taps the hamburger icon to access hidden navigation links.
narrative_steps.action: Click the hamburger menu icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Mobile navigation slides open revealing all dashboard sections.

requirement_tested: Configuration in package.json for `npm run install:all` to install frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A DevOps engineer setting up a fresh development environment.
user_goal: Install all project dependencies quickly using a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Jake clones the repo and runs the installation script to prepare both environments.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend folders have their node_modules installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Configuration in package.json for `npm run dev` to start both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A full-stack developer beginning daily development work.
user_goal: Launch both frontend and backend services with one terminal command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Maya uses the convenience script to boot up both development servers together.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend starts on port 3000 and backend on port 8080 simultaneously in the same terminal session.
